page.title: 11FARMING (cont)
page.content: have introduced milk quotas into the country.One farm we saw had computerised the milking parlour and the feeding systems and had employed a heat transfer system on the cooling tank for the milk.The EEC has also meant that the farms can always sell their milk to somebody at a set price. Most farmers use this as an easy way to sell their milk, although the selling price may not be as high as if they were to obtain a private contract from a company.Income is not very high for the area and one farmer earned below Â£5,000 a year;others are better off. In our area there are many hedges and there is not a tendancy for farmers to remove them as in other areas.The average anual rainfall is around 700mm. per year.Soils are good.
